Reviews.Title: “Perfect combination of price, quality and location!”
Reviews.Author: Maryana L
Reviews.Content: Very nice small hotel situated n the centre of Rome (approximately 15 min walk from railway station). Even though it's rated as 1 or 2 star hotel, it's very good. Nice lobby with friendly receptionists, free internet access, happy hour from 6 till 8 with free champagne and snacks. Rooms are very clean, with nice furniture. There is even a minibar! the one really small disadvantage, that front desk situates in another building, 1 min walk and internet provided only there. If you go to Rome, it's defenetly the bes option!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect quaint hotel with quality, elegance and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Kahuna8899
Reviews.Content: After being referred to this wonderful hotel in the heart of Rome we were a bit suspicious due to the very affordable price. After arriving finding the elegant lobby with very helpful staff and being escorted to our room in an adjoining building which was exactly what we needed: comfort with all the expected ammenities. The hotels has an elevator, WiFi in the lobby, Happy Hour with free wine and snacks as well as included breakfast and I highly recommend Hotel Picasso! Tell them Paul Klink referred you. Live Aloha, Paul Klink

Reviews.Title: “RQH”
Reviews.Author: Martin C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Picasso is part of a small chain, RQH, and although we booked the Picasso we stayed at the Hotel Caravaggio which was just around the corner. We were greeted in reception by friendly efficient staff. The room was on the second floor at the side of the building, and had no view, but we wanted to see the sights of Rome, not sit in a hotel room, so no problem for us. The room was clean, comfortable, furnished in traditional Italian style one level up from shabby chique, and the small ensuite room quite adequate with a good shower. The room was made up every day while we were out. Breakfast was served between 7:30 and 9:30pm and was standard continental fayre. There was a bit of a squeeze sitting at some tables in the breakfast area. The ancient Roman forum was 15 minutes walk down the Via Nazionale, and Termini Station a similar distance. If you want a no frills, convenient and inexpensive base from which to explore Rome, you can't do much better than Hotel Caravaggio. We would definitely stay here again. Well done RQH.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION - WELL PRICED”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: My advice is to ignore the 'one star' rating. The reason this hotel is rated as 'one star' is because no reception is within the hotel block. However, please note that a 24 hr reception is available within 50 metres away from the hotel - no big deal to walk 50m! The hotel is warm and clean. The cleaners make sure you have everything you need. The windows of the hotel do not stop sound from entering the room but its not like you're on a highway! This hotel is located about 100m away from Via Nazzionale. The sound problem did not bug us at all but it might bug some people who are too sensitive to noise. If that's the problem them go to Hawaii not Rome :) Breakfast room is way too small for the hotel and the breakfast is nothing extraordinary....but hey...considering the price you pay for this hotel...its still very good! You get bread, orange juice, cofee, cake, crossaints etc... The bread was a bit dry and I do recommend that the management take note of this. So my advice is: if you are looking for a warm, cheap, clean place to stay in the centre of Rome (walking distance from all attractions!)...and you are not expecting a silver service, then I will highly recommend this hotel. Again, do not worry about the '1 star' rating...in fact, you will wonder why it is a '1 star' at the end of your holiday. In my opinion is hotel is great...I will go again in future when I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: nellalucedelsole
Reviews.Content: We were booked into here by the nice guy at the hotel desk at Termini station after a couple of other ghastly hotel experiences in Rome. He asked the owner to give us a good room so we got a nice decent enough size room on the top floor overlooking the Viminal. The only drawback was that everyday the owner whinged and whinged about how she had given us the 'quadruple room'!!! (The room was ok for two people but for four people it would have been a case of fighting for breathing space......god knows how she gets four adults sleeping in there) The breakfast room was tiny but overall a good experience, I liked the view on the Viminal and other than the owner's whinging and sighing it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “No good for a family”
Reviews.Author: Mick R
Reviews.Content: As a standard double room on a budget this was acceptable. But adding two extra beds leaving no floor space does not make it suitable as a family room. Would be ok without the family. Read other comments re breakfast room being small (again, ok if on a budget without the family) air conditioner struggled and didn't provide the cool respite you need in Rome during summer. Not the greatest part of Rome but accessible to a lot. No issues with reception not being in the same building, it is literally around the corner. If you are going with the family, open your wallet and spend more for a more suitable option!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and nice, love it!”
Reviews.Author: marilee2815
Reviews.Content: We managed to check in when we arrived at the hotel just after lunch. The staff patiently showed us around. Even though our air-con rooms does not seems to work that well, the management staff immediately attend to it even without us calling the reception counter.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: minakrsman
Reviews.Content: Although it is a bit strange that a reception desk is in another street, it's not far at all, and I didn't mind that. It was very clean; simple furniture, but beds were welcoming after hours of walking around the city. Everyone was very kind and helpful; breakfast was OK, we had pastries and juices and great coffee. We even didn't mind that place where we ate breakfast is, in fact, very tiny room. Location is the best. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I should have chosen another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marcia002
Reviews.Content: There are many reasons for not staying there again: 1st - There is no reception. You must go to the Caravaggio Hotel on Palermo Street. There they give you a key to open the front door at of the Picasso Hotel which stays on Venezia Street. This is very strange. 2nd - The decoration is horrible. Nothing matches to nothing. Very bad taste. 3rd - It's dirty mainly the toilet. 4th - The phone doesn't work at all. None in this hotel according to my friends. 5th- the lift is from pre-historical period. It even needs a 10 cents coin to work and it has 2 manual doors (a wood and an iron one) Finally ... they refuse to give me any receipt. At the Caravaggio front desk they told me they would send to my e-mail but they didn't despite all my constant requests.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location,terrible bathroom, jacket stolen from room”
Reviews.Author: adamch5
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in the beginning of April. Hotel has nice location 5min walking from metro and 15 min from many sites. Room was small but good enough especially when you do not spend a lot of time in there. Breakfast was nice and big enough (partially self-service) - no meat but I can not complain. The most terrible thing was bathroom and dirtiness of shower, toilet even some mould on the ceiling. My wife had serious problems with using bathroom. Please check photos. TV worked but only as a radio - no TV stations available. On third day of stay I noticed that my leather jacket is missing from my room. It got stolen when we were gone for sightseeing. I locked all documents and other things that fits to safe box but unfortunately I cannot lock all my clothes. Lady from reception didn't seem to be surprised. Her only help was redirection us to police station. I haven't even heard "sorry" I do not recommend this hotel - dirty - you need to have good insurance if you want to leave your clothes there

Reviews.Title: “VERY SATISFIED...”
Reviews.Author: nish407
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel..central location,perfect staff..helpful. Satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kbel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five nights. We paid 112.80 Euros per night, which I think is a very low price for being in Rome and for having an in suite bathroom. The room was very clean. We never heard the buzzer complained about in other reviews. The included breakfast was simple but good. There were croissants, some filled, cereal, yogurt, and fresh fruit, as well as juice and choice of coffee. The location is great because it is centrally located, close to metro stations, and close to good restaurants. The area also felt very safe at night. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy hotel but icy water in the shower”
Reviews.Author: iankbugeja
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, very accomodating staff and nice clean rooms. Breakfast was good too for the price we paid (EUR30 nightly). The worst part was that electricity kept cutting off and we ended without hot water on one particular occasion which meant cold water like what you get out of a fridge!! We had to wait to shower. It is not your typical hotel - it is housed in a Palazzo which means apartment block therefore the hotel entrance is shared with other apartment owners, one of which was not so keen in seeing tourists using the lift which stops very often (lift is very old and you have to use a 10cent coin). The room in which we stayed is located in a former apartment which was converted into hotel rooms. Reception of the hotel picasso is actually located a corner away at the hotel caravaggio. One one occassion we had breakfast prepared early since we were leaving for a day trip. Overall the hotel has many positive attributes and the inconveniences were tackled by the staff positively therefore it served the purpose well of a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Picasso, Only OK”
Reviews.Author: Travellers_in_20s
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2010. We picked this hotel because we were on a tight budget and were looking for something cheap and cheerful. That is almost what we got. We chose this hotel as we used online reviews and the majority of them claimed this to be a great hotel. We can only say this was an OK hotel. Firstly this is not really a hotel, is appears as if it is overflow rooms for the Hotel Caravaggio across the street, where you check in and out. The room was ok, small, very much a budget room although you are not paying budget prices, and the air conditioning did not work properly. In the heat of Rome city in June the air conditioning did nothing to comfort us, it also let in an awful lot of mosquitoes which didn't make us anymore comfortable. On arrival, we didn't exactly get a warm welcome, even though we were soaked to the skin from rain, we were made wait to check in, although there was no other guests checking in. We were then brought across the street, to the first floor of a separate building, which houses a few rooms, this making up the Hotel Picasso, from what we could see. It came across as if these used to be old staff rooms which they converted to guest rooms although for the price you are charged for them there was not much effort put into them. There is internet access in the lobby of the Hotel Caravaggio across the street, they also held a 'Happy Hour' there in the evenings. The location was ok, just off Via Nazionale, a main street with shops and restaurants, with Piazza della Repubblica at the top. Besides this all of the other attractions were a good walk away. We personally would never stay here again, and I would tell my friends that if they have that much money to spend on a hotel to look elsewhere as this is not worth the money. We stayed in other hotels in Italy and got a much better deal for half the money, although keeping in mind this is Rome. We would not recomment this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T EVER STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: vacation-travel-love
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely awful. We arrived in Rome after more than a week in other parts of Italy to find the staff rude, pushy, and totally unaccommodating. The room was so small we couldn't walk around the bed without crashing into each other and the bathroom so small the door didn't even open all the way. The website says no smoking, but don't believe it... the room stank of stale cigarette smoke and there was an ash tray in the nightstand. The "bed" wasn't even a bed... it was two cots shoved together and neither of them had much support left in them, and one of them was so dead that I sank down over a foot when I sat on it. We lost the equivalent of a whole day dealing with the fiasco that arose out of this hotel, including the chaos that resulted when we checked out early after we (luckily) found an alternative. For not much more per night, you can go and stay at the Albergo Santa Chiara hotel, a stone's throw from the Pantheon, with MUCH better services and MUCH better location and MUCH better staff. We are a young professional couple and don't need much, but this was wholly unacceptable. A truly awful experience.

Reviews.Title: “very good but noisy”
Reviews.Author: chgus
Reviews.Content: nice clean hotel, a bit more expensive than others but still a good option. Breakfast good, service highly sufficient, but the main problem is noise. We stayed at first floor and we could hear the street as if we were outside. First night was terrible, then, walking, eaiting, visiting, and walking, and walking in Rome make you feel tired as you like, and you can sleep as a baby.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy accommodation”
Reviews.Author: FinlandHeidi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I we have visited Rome for the first time. We had a wonderful holiday. Rome is a very nice city full of interesting sights. The Hotel Picasso was a good choice: central and safe position, proffessional and friendly staff, clean and spacious rooms, rich breakfast, free internet and happy hour each evening. We can warmly recommend this hotel to other turist. We will sure come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: sydneyseine
Reviews.Content: This hotel, as mentioned by others, is really just rooms in an apartment block. Ours was very clean, quite nicely decorated (bathroom is sparkling and looked new), and the staff at the reception of the Hotel Caravaggio were very pleasant. They spoke English. It was only a ten-minute walk to the Colosseum, and 20 minutes to Piazza Navona. Breakfast was excellent with a large choice of yummy pastries etc. Downsides: Our view was of walls and air conditioning ducts - the room was quite dark. The air conditioning was quite weak and inadequate. No services except breakfast, no restaurant or bar to hang out in. But for 60-odd euros, it was good value for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: WilmaAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, good room, good shower, good airconditioning, and fantastic location, just off the Via Nazionale (buses) and close to Termini station. Friendly staff, also at the reception (in Hotel Caravaggio, around the corner). Super stay.

Reviews.Title: “You can't trust this hotel”
Reviews.Author: superhero077
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for about 7 days. At the 5 day we had to leave due to a electricity-problem. During the stay there were also earlier problem with electricity going in and out all hours of the day. They tried to cheat us in to taking another hotel they said was great, but turned out to be with a very cheap standard and without air-condition. We had to walk 1 hour in 36 degress to find out this ourselves. We denied to take the room, and after much fuzz they placed us at another hotell with air-condition. We would not recommend this hotel. This sort of treatment is not what you want.

Reviews.Title: “Bright and clean hotel with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: travel-MLandCM
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said the room we stayed in was quite small, however we weren't staying at the Picasso to hang out in our room, it was clean, nicely decorated, quiet, had a comfortable bed and a lovely bathroom with a great shower andmost importantly was in a really great location. Breakfast wasn't the best but they did have some nice pastries on offer so it was fine. The only thing which did disapoint us about Picasso was we bookedonlinefor a price of 87Euro per night (on their own website) and on arrival they told us it wasonly 67Euro per night which we were pleased about, however on our deparfture they asked us to pay the difference (after they had our bag in storage for us, not when we checked out). I was happy to pay what we thought we owed but if it had been a mistake we should have been told as soon as it was picked up, not 30mins before we left for the airport as we had been travelling on a budget and believed we had had thismoney to spend.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mzdiggs
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome In September for 2 nights, and as a woman travelling alone, I wanted to make sure that I was in a safe area, and close to everything.. And that is exactly was this hotel was... Granted the room I stayed in was Very SMALL, but it was a single room, and I would say standard for any other hotel in Europe. The only thing to keep in mind is that the elevator costs 5 cents per use... I plan on going back to ROME, and I will probably be staying here again... All the main attractions are in walking distance, as well as shopping and good food. Oh almost forgot , the Double Decker tour bus stop is not far from the hotel either. When I would venture out at night for dinner or dessert, I felt safe walking back to my hotel. I highly reccommed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very small, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ACIsrael
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for a week, in a single room. The room was incredibly tiny - its width was about the width of two single beds, tiny table and closet. Couldn't open my suitcase and the entrance door at the same time... Bathroom (shower) was also tiny. All in all, it felt claustrophobic even in european standards. The AC wasn't working (it was May and quite hot already), so there was no way of getting any air except for the window (no curtain, so those who are wakened by the sunlight, like myself - beware). The hotel is on the second or third floor, and you have to be buzzed in when entering (the main door of the building is locked). The best thing was the location - just a few steps from Via Nazionale, Piazza dela Reublica and within walking distance from most of the main touristic attractions. The staff was weren't very nice, hardly spoke any english and weren't very helpful, even when I got stuck with a heavy suitcase and a non-operating lift (and that's its state often).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: caughtalitesneeze
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed there for 4 days in April. The room looks just like the picture. They cleaned the room every day. The Bathroom, though small, was very clean. We had MP3 Players, Ipod's, and cameras; we left them in the room at different times - nothing was stolen. The breakfast was not a traditional western breakfast, however, there was still lots to choose from. Croissants, toast, cereals, breads, cheeses, juices, milks teas and coffee. They had a server who brought you your tea or coffee, and to clean afterwards. The Breakfast room was small, but the tables were setup nice, and I was quite comfortable and well fed. You have to buzz the front door to get in after a certain time at night, but someone was always there to let you in. We found this perfect as we arrived late at night, and or adventures kept us out late as well. We knew about the buzzer beforehand, so we brought earplugs - never heard a thing. I would bring earplugs for every hotel in either case; in Italy hotel room walls are on the thinner side. There is a GREAT restaurant directly next door to the Hotel, and we ate there a couple of times. It was perfect for when you were tired and hungry after a long day of walking, and so we didn't have far to walk back after eating. Also, there is a bakery about 2 doors down from the hotel as well, and we would pick up a few treats to add to our breakfast (though it wasn't really needed) or to eat for dessert. The Metro Train Station is a short walk away, as well as the city subway. It wasn't even that far to walk to downtown historic Rome either (colosseum, palatine). Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “We know what hotels in Europe are like”
Reviews.Author: Nanni07
Reviews.Content: When we were there, there were a lot of blackouts (about 3 a day) and the bathroom smelled something strange. I have been in other hotels of 2 stars (eg Paris) and the breakfast was much more complete than this one. It must be said that the room we were assigned had nothing to do with the room of the pictures they show. One of the two beds(we thought that we would have a double bed instead of twin) had the matress in apalling conditions, and we had to sleep in the same bed. However, the stay was pleasant, but because it is very well located and because I went with my girlfriend. It must also be said that the staff was very nice. If I had to score the hotel without taking into account the location I would give more or less a 3 (of 10).

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Very Basic”
Reviews.Author: malibumelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in Jan, booked through the Hotel website for 170 Euros. We didnt think we would be in the Hotel that much so we just wanted something basic and walking distance to everything we wanted to see eg:Colleseum (10 min) , Trevi (15 min), Spanish Steps (20 mins) & Vatican (30 mins) - the Train station is 15 minute walk. The rooms are really small with tiny bathrooms but they are clean and very suitable just to stay the night - I wouldnt recommend this hotel if you want luxury and to hang out in the hotel. The hotel has a fantastic restaurant around the corner called 'Ricci' in a little laneway - its where locals eat, we ate there twice it was so good.

Reviews.Title: “great place in a great city”
Reviews.Author: crista7878
Reviews.Content: Cheap is not allways something that means have no quality. This is what i concluded after a trip in Rome where i stayed al Hotel Picasso. I admite, at the begining i was a little worried about the hotel. I thought ,, is cheap i expect what is worst''. BUT is was a great experience. The rooms are kept very clean. I also found the hotel staff very friendly and helpfull. VERY IMPORTANT The location is excellent, because is situated in an area where you find many things, monument to see within walking distance. They offered also a basic breakfast. For a double room, 2 beds i paied 65 euro. In a single frase : it worth every money i paied

Reviews.Title: “Picasso was perfect for me.”
Reviews.Author: gyjennings
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for five days. The rooms are a little small but met my needs very well and they were kept very clean. I found the staff very personable and friendly. The location is excellent, there are so many places to see within walking distance. The offered breakfast was basic, yet I found it to be very good for my tastes. I am very pleased to have stayed at this hotel. It was easy to find walking from the train station. It was staffed by very friendly people. It was clean and comfortable. The best compliment I can give is that I am very happy to have stayed at the Hotel Picasso and I would definitely stay here again on a return visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: nibur
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very small, but the rooms are clean and it is in a good location. The first night I shared a room with my friend and it was nice except that it was right next to the front desk and we could hear the buzzer every time someone came to the front door. Thankfully we slept with earplugs and that solved the problem. The room was small, but clean. The next day my friend's husband came to stay with us and I switched to my own room. This room was located in the middle of the building and did not contain a window, I don't think it is legal in the US! Again the room was small, but clean and despite not having a window, it was ok for the two nights I stayed there. The hotel has breakfast, but it is served in a very tiny room and the food was ok, just cereal, rolls and coffee. It served it's purpose and saved me a few euros. There are plenty of shops and restaurants in the neighborhood so you can easily eat elsewhere. The hotel isn't far from the metro, Colosseum, and Trevi Fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Just don't”
Reviews.Author: wilmingtonnanny
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel was inexpensive, it was not even worth the money we did spend. The hotel staff was not very helpful, the elevator cost money to ride, our shower was broken and never fixed (despite our requests and the promisses of the staff, each day of our 5 day stay), they say they have air conditioning but they only have it 3 months out of the year and even then it is an extra charge. The breakfast was minimal (roll and coffee) but that was ok, but a real let down after our great continental breakfast at the hotel in Florence (Hotel Maxium/Axial) Our hotel in Florence was MUCH nicer and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: zenpazienzia
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great position near metro, train and buses, also perfect to go walking to almost everywhere.. Rooms are ok, but nothing great (see my photos for a single camera). Clean also. There´s an elevator but you have to put 10 cents to use it. The problem is not the price, but to have always a 10 cents coin. The place is safe. Breakfast is a normal italian breakfast. Staff is ok. Price is normal to Rome, were everything is overpriced. But pay attention, avoid booking directly with the hotel because it seems that they do higher prices. Try a good research first, with expdedia, venere, etc.

Reviews.Title: “ok!”
Reviews.Author: carlesp
Reviews.Content: good location, very clean. Wide room with small bathroom but, again, very clean. You could hear what happens in the corridon , but it's not much as there are few rooms. No noise from the street. Nice staff, helpful. Breakfast in tiny room consists in: Oj, toasts, coffee, cereals. Recommended for what's in Rome. And good price! Look for the ice cream at the closest bar in Via Nazionale!

Reviews.Title: “Economical Hotel in a Strategic Location in Rome City Center”
Reviews.Author: Eeklin
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived at the hotel...I was having difficulty finding it. There isnt a big size signboard to show its location. Moreover, the reception is at 1st level of a building. There's no lobby though. Anyhow, he size of hotel room was pretty good but the toilet was pretty small. There were clean towels everyday but the bedsheets were not changed throughout my stay for 4 nights. The hotel is situated off the Via Nazionale main street...minimizing the traffic noises. However, I had a terrible time when the Filipino receptionist were talking on top of their voices while I was taking my rest. It was obviously very irritating when I was trying to get a good rest from my jet lag. Anyway, the hotel comes with a simple breakfast...not very impressive but at least there's something to eat. There are lots of cafes and shops near the hotel. So its very convenient. The tourist attractions are closeby. So walking around Rome with a map is hand is feasible. Oh yea...there's a convenience store - Despar near the hotel where you can get your drinks,food and toiletries at reasonable prices. Avoid buying water from tourist spots...very expensive. Anyway, I will consider anyone who is on a budget to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and well situated”
Reviews.Author: Lovetostay
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated in the Via Venezia, which is a side-street from Via Nazionale. You can walk to all the 'attractions'. Hotel was very clean. We paid 57 euros pppn. Check various sites/organizations for prices can differ a great amount in specific periods/ by specific sites/travel agents. I wouldn't recommand booking directly at the hotel. I called to be sure, but it was way more expensive! The rates on their site are just a teaser...(or for one or two rooms, which ofcourse are more often than not already booked.) Don't expect luxery, but a clean room, a good shower and clean towels & linnen and a good location. (We only took the metro once, to be at St. Pieter really early in the morning.) The staff in friendly. Right next to the hotel is a really nice trattoria (da tito/ al venezia) where the food is really good (and cheap!). Order an 'Amaro' (liqor) with your espresso after the home made tiramisu or panna cotta! A lot of Italians there, and a waiting queu after 19.15. (Order the daily specials!) So come in time! There is also a nice patisserie on number 11/13. (next to the restaurant) which totally makes up for the breakfast at the hotel, which is not much. All together, we really had a nice stay! And a last remark: a lot of info sites and guides state that you can drink the tap water in Rome. Indeed you can, if you have a normal stomach. If you are a little sensitive (like I) please drink water from bottels, or you will be hanging over the (clean) toilet at night...And that's a waste of time in the beautiful city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: CrazyTourist
Reviews.Content: Even tho the room was small, it was clean and towels were changed daily. The breakfast room is small but as it was February it was never full. Breakfast consisted of a basket of fresh rolls, lovely cheese spread and jam. There were generous portions and it certainly filled us up till lunch. The location of the hotel is excellent as it is only 5 mins from the Termini station. Would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Clean and Comfy”
Reviews.Author: Heartfulart
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel in Rome for one night, since I had a very early flight to Paris the next day. I found the Hotel Picasso online and booked my room for 65 Euros. I have to admit, when I checked in around 2 pm I wasn't thrilled with the room at at first glance, but the women at the desk were somewhat helpful. I only stayed long enough to leave my suitcases and venture out into the neighborhood. It wasn't until I came back in the evening that I realized I had found a gem! Everything has been totally renovated and the room was spotless. New tile floors, headboard, and bathroom fixtures made the atmosphere clean and cozy. The bathroom was small, but nicely designed. The neighborhood is really convenient and safe, and only a few blocks from the train station and shuttle busses to the airport (by the way, you can buy shuttle tickets from the hotel across the street from where the busses line up for quite a discount). There are cafes, stores and everything you need nearby - this is a real Roman neighborhood, NOT a typical tourist area, so I found that a welcome relief after traveling around for a couple of weeks! Having had enough pizza and pasta for a while, I actually ended my stay in Italy by having Chinese food at a little cafe a couple blocks away from my hotel! I had good service and they called a cab for me at 5:30 am so I could get to the airport on time. I really recommend this hotel to anyone who wants an economical, clean and pleasant place to stay while in Rome. Probably not the place to stay if you are planning on spending a lot of time in the room, since it's pretty small, but it was spotless. A very good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Small and excellent”
Reviews.Author: mtbiker
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel, so don't expect five-star luxuries. The hotel is very clean, pleasant, and efficiently run. As a family, we stayed in two rooms, a double, and a quad for the 3 kids. Both were immaculate. the breakfasts were typical good continental breakfasts, with excellent coffee. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The location is central and excellent. Marius van Blerck (South Africa)

Reviews.Title: “Higher end 2** hotel”
Reviews.Author: LaParisienne
Reviews.Content: Location: A convenient 10 minute walk from Termini. It is close to the Colosseum (10 min. walk). Many attractions are geographically clumped together (Trevi, Campodiglio, Spanish Steps), and Picasso is a 10 minute walk from the edge of that "clump." I would've preferred being more central. Rooms/Hotel: Decent sized triple by European standards w/ smallish, rather inconvenient bathroom. Clean, and nicely decorated. Room faced street which was a bit noisy. Italian tv only. Shower curtain was too small so there was a large pool of water after our showers. We asked for extra towels twice to no avail. Etc.: Adequate breakfast for a budget place - bread, fresh coffee, unlimited cereal, juice. Breakfast room is so tiny that at times there are people waiting for a table. Staff was friendly, but I have one complaint - at check-in, we were told we had to pay cash because the credit card machine was broken. I told the front desk that getting this much cash was a problem for us on short notice (I had recently been mugged), but they just smiled and shrugged. After getting the cash (and incurring high fees), I went to the front desk to pay, but expressed displeasure at the inconvenience and asked for a cash discount - something less than what they saved in credit card transaction fees so still more than what they would've gotten if I were paying with a credit card. At that point, the front desk said that they could swipe our credit card at another hotel. The fact that they did not mention this in the first place is not good service. And if I were a more cynical person, I would think that their credit card machine is broken all the time. The Picasso was a decent value for a last minute booking during high season, but the problems I encountered are not the kind that differentiates budget from luxury accommodations, but okay hotels from good hotels. For the problems I encountered, I wondered if I wouldn't have been better off at a true pension or nice hostel and paying less. If your hotel options are limited like mine were, then the Picasso is an okay choice. Otherwise, I recommend staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “They put us up in one of their other hotels”
Reviews.Author: travellers_from_oz
Reviews.Content: We booked in to Hotel Picasso for a five night stay during late February, over the internet. However, when we got there we were told at the desk that they were having some plumbing problems and so they had decided to put us up in one of their other hotels, just around the corner, which has a higher star rating, but for the price we had already booked at. We were very impressed by this and the staff of both hotels were very accomodating. From what we could see both hotels were very similar in style, interior and location- please see my review of the Hotel Caravaggio, Rome, for a more in-depth review. So if you stay here you can rest assured that the staff are very decent and honest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: omygod!
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel picasso because of the good reports on this site. We were very impressed with this hotel, excellent value for money and the best 2* I have ever stayed in. The staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were very clean, had mini fridge, TV, hairdryer and heating/air con. Location was good, only 5-10 min walk from most sites. There is a nice restaraunt directly opposite which you can also get takeaway from and Spar is at the end of the road. I would definately stay again and would highly reccommend hotel picasso to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good price/service ratio”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi, Just returned from a 4 days visit to Rome. I stayed in the Picasso Hotel after reviewing the other posts and I must say it didn´t disappoint me. The situation is fantastic, very close to everywhere (we used to come back by midday to have a little rest). The room is clean and renewed recently. And the Reception lady was very kind. Restaurant is very little but functional.

Reviews.Title: “Small Price, Small Facilitities”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everthing is small in this hotel. Small bathroom, small rooms, small breakfast-room with small bread! On the other hand I can recommend this hotel to everyone. It's from walking distance to the Termini Train Station and Some major attractions (Trevi Fountain, Spanish Stairs, Forum Romanum) All reachable within 15 minutes And the hotel is very clean. Like people sayd before: Excellent coffee in BIG cups!

Reviews.Title: “good for its price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was in the Hotel Picasso in December, and I will surely go back. The room -single- was clean and spatious, it had a safe and a little fridge. The staff were very helpful and the breakfast was ok. The bathroom was quite small, but this can be expected at this price. The only problem, in my view, is that you have to pay cash - credit cards are not accepted.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and location”
Reviews.Author: madly99
Reviews.Content: A friend and I just returned from an overnight trip in Rome. We chose the Hotel Picasso based on its proximity to the Termini train station and major attractions, and for its very reasonable price of 75EUR for a twin bedded room. We booked through their online website and although we didn't get our e-mail confirmation right away, I got one after sending a note to the booking company. Our room was spacious and included a refrigerator and safe, although we did not make use of either. The bathroom also had plenty of room and modern fixtures, although only half of the shower is enclosed in glass - an arrangement I've seen at other budget hotels. The beds were comfortable and everything was very clean. It was a little noisy at night because we were near the front desk and could hear the buzzer for people arriving late. They do have rooms on other floors as well, which are probably not as noisy. The included breakfast was nothing special, except for the excellent coffee - otherwise, just bread, butter, cream cheese, and corn flakes. We were in easy walking distance of all the attractions and even managed to walk from the hotel to the Vatican and back, stopping at sites in between. It's less than 10 minutes from the train station and slightly farther to the Trevi Fountain. Great price and location, and a clean, simple, but more than adequate room - I'd definitely stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Picasso
HotelInfo.Address: Via Venezia 25, 00184 Rome, Italy
